about.info: Most recently, I was part of an Agile cross-functional team at Infor tasked with migrating the codebase for an existing enterprise application from Windows Form to ASP.Net MVC. We leveraged Web Services and XML while working with our Australian counterparts to deliver the desired solution. We used JavaScript and jQuery for front-end and, aside from development, I was assigned to build and deploy our server for my QA team for their testing processes. Also, I mentored one of my new team members. I have experence working with small teams to develop trading platforms using C#, WPF and SQL for foreign exchange companies.

I like to solve problems on my own and find satisfaction when the solutions I developed are working. However, I also believe that working collaboratively with a team is crucial to delivery of the product. So, if there is a particularly difficult problem, I collaborate with my colleagues and use it as a learning experience to improve my skills.

I enjoy learning new technologies and currently Iâ€™m doing some React.js and Xamarin development which is live on Heroku. I love to bake, cook, take photographs, cycle, travel and play games with friends.
Looking forward to connecting with ICT professionals.

experience.name: Infor
experience.title: Software Engineer

Conducted unit testing and regression testing for functionality and quality control

Created and presented weekly data presentations to team
Assigned as point person for server deployment and implemented a systematic approach
Coached new team member to familiarise herself about the development processes of the team
Acted as Scrum Master on the first phase of the development
Assigned as point person for overseeing the front-end development of the team and reporting of bugs to Infor's design team based in USA
tools: MS Team Foundation Server (TFS) for version control and project management

projects.name: GloomBlue
projects.description: A simple weather app created using React.js that displays the weather information based on the inputted city name. It consumes data from OpenWeatherMap and uses https://datahub.io/core/country-list to convert country code based on 2 digit codes (ISO 3166-1) into their full name. Map can also be displayed (provided by react-leaflet) base on the geo coordinates of the city.

projects.name: Artist's Popular Tracks | Spotify
projects.description: A simple app created using React.js that lists the popular songs from a particular artist. The app displays the album cover and some info upon clicking on the song(card). This utilizes Spotify's APIs to search for artist ID, albums, and songs.

skills.info: javaScript, jQuery, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, React.js

tools.info: Visual Studio, Visual Studio Code, TFS, JIRA, GitHub
